result.execSummary:
The defendant Noel A Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Noel A Castillo in court with attorney Anne Cohen.  Defendant Noel A Castillo in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin. on both 14CF1041 and 15CF470.

State indicates they are Chapter 950 compliant, no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Defense indicates no additions or corrections to revocation packet.

State recommends 1 year RCJ on each, consecutive to each other.
Defense requests 1 year RCJ, concurrent to each other.

BTC:  1 year RCJ on each, concurrent to each other.

CIP and SAT eligible
Firearms/voting warnings given.
Costs including DNA on both
CFTS
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Noel A Castillo in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed both PSI's. The State notes that the actual recommendation by the agent in regards to Ct 4 of 14CF1041, probation is permissible for an OWI 2nd offense however, there must also be a mandatory minimum of at least 5 days RCJ. 
The State intially got a restituiton request for $5,000.00. The victim indicated that insurance paid for most of it but there were more items not covered. Victim was contacted in October and there was a subsequent follow up but the victim did not provide any further information

BTC: 14CF1041, Ct 1 - w/held sent - 2 yrs probation
                             Ct 4 - 10 days RCJ/CFTS, $350.00 + cc, alc assessment, 1 yr DLR, 1 yr IID. 60 dtp. FTP - 3 mos RCJ
                                            report in February 20, 2016 by 8:30 am
         15CF470, Ct 1 - w/held sent - 1 yr prob, conc with 14CF1041

Conditions: 
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP

Defendant Noel A Castillo in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. The State noted that this matter was adjourned due to some statements made by the defendant. Ms. Anderson has reviewed PSI and has discussed same as well as statements made by defendant. The defense indicates that they have been unable to verify comments made in the PSI.

BTC: Due to circumstances, the Court asks that another PSI be done because the Court wishes the person that does the PSI be available at the time of sentencing if there are questions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Noel A Castillo in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Noel A Castillo in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. 
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.

RR-Dawn
4:14 pm

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive at all.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780) exceptions are going to court, work and meeting with his Atty. He must reside with his parents.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing on June 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Noel A Castillo in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Noel A Castillo in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State recommends $2,000.00 cash in 15CF470. In 14CF1041, the State recommends $1000.00 cash as well.

BTC: 15CF470 - $1000.00 cash. Same terms and conditions as 14CF1041
         14CF1041 - $1000.00 cash bond. Same terms and conditions. Reinstate bond in 14CF1041
         The Court finds good cause to waive time limits  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry.
